meanings.definition: To predict or foretell future events.
meanings.sent1: The wise old man was prophesizing about a great storm coming.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys prophesizing about what the weather will be like tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The cat was prophesizing that it would rain fish from the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were prophesizing a bright future ahead.
meanings.sent5: The crystal ball was prophesizing a journey full of adventure.

meanings.definition: To speak or write about something that will happen in the future.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was prophesizing the upcoming school trip to the zoo.
meanings.sent2: He was prophesizing the outcome of the basketball game.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was prophesizing a world where birds ruled over humans.
meanings.sent4: His words were prophesizing a revolution in the way people think.
meanings.sent5: The fortune teller was prophesizing a meeting with a mysterious stranger.

meanings.definition: To make a prediction or forecast.
meanings.sent1: The meteorologist was prophesizing heavy rain for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: They were prophesizing a bright future for the company.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was prophesizing a winter with endless acorns.
meanings.sent4: The ancient book was prophesizing the rise of a new king.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was prophesizing a breakthrough in technology.
